DRAW A 2D SKETCH ON THE XY PLANE Sketch the overall shape of the part on the XY plane. The sketch will consist of two rectangular faces: face_1 and face_2, positioned side by side. 1.2. DEFINE THE LOOPS AND CURVES FOR SKETCH FACE_1 Face_1 has a loop_1 consisting of 4 lines, as follows: line_1: Start Point (0.0, 0.0), End Point (0.0069, 0.0) line_2: Start Point (0.0069, 0.0), End Point (0.0069, 0.0069) line_3: Start Point (0.0069, 0.0069), End Point (0.0, 0.0069) line_4: Start Point (0.0, 0.0069), End Point (0.0, 0.0) 1.3. TRANSFORM THE SKETCH INTO 3D USING EULER ANGLES AND TRANSLATION VECTOR Rotate the 2D sketch using the specified euler angles (-90.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translate to the origin with the translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). 1.6. EXTRUDE THE SKETCH TO CREATE THE 3D MODEL Extrude the 3D model along the Z-axis by 0.75 units, resulting in a slightly tapered cylindrical object. The length of this part is 0.75, width 0.0069, and height 0.0069. As there are no instructions for further operations or constructing other parts, proceed to generate the final parametric CAD model using the CAD Assembly JSON provided.</description>
